                            </div>
                            <div class="para-small spinner-caption">
                                Don’t Fall for Impostors posing as the North Carolina Department of the Secretary to lure loan-seekers to pay an up-front fee.  Report instances of this to the <a class="white-link" href="https://ncdoj.gov/protecting-consumers/">North Carolina Attorney General’s Office</a> or 1-877-5-NO-SCAM.
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>

        <a class="next spinnerArrow" style="display: none;" onclick="plusSlides(1)">❯</a>
        <!-- The dots/circles -->

        </div>

                                    <a class="usa-summary-box__link" href="/online_services/notary/e_notary_appointment">Register as an eNotary</a>
                                </li>
                                <li>
                                    <a class="usa-summary-box__link" href="/online_services/Notary_Search/notary_search">Confirm a Notary</a>
                                </li>

                                </ul>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
            <br>
            <div class="grid-row grid-gap">
                <div class="tablet:grid-col">

            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=233993747d51fd1eed6b3d54babf9b5d23a88f0f&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);

            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

<section class="usa-banner">

                        <span role="link" class="usa-banner__button-text">
                            Here's how you know
                        </span>
                    </button>
                </div>
            </header>
            <div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

</section>

                            </div>
                            <div class="para-small spinner-caption">
                                Don’t Fall for Impostors posing as the North Carolina Department of the Secretary to lure loan-seekers to pay an up-front fee.  Report instances of this to the <a class="white-link" href="https://ncdoj.gov/protecting-consumers/">North Carolina Attorney General’s Office</a> or 1-877-5-NO-SCAM.
                            </div>

            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=8bd04c7637828814293c1f8215e2155b1283a178&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 422px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);
            });
        });

			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">

                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

</section>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

<div class="slideshow-container">

        <div class="mySlides fade" style="display: block;">

                <div class="usa-hero" role="img" aria-label="North Carolina Secretary of State, Elaine Marshall, in a blue coat in front of the North Carolina State Capitol." onfocus="mySlidesFocus()" onblur="mySlidesBlur()" style="height:375px;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url('/webfiles/img/g_elaine_capital.jpg')!important">
                    <div class="grid-container">

                        <div class="usa-hero__callout">
                            <div class="usa-hero__heading">
                                    <a class="spinnerHeader" href="/rural_rise">Rural RISE NC</a>
                            </div>
                            <div class="para-small spinner-caption">
                                Our Rural RISE NC initiative connects you with mentors, business counselors, funding sources, and more—within your community and beyond. And even better, many of these resources are free.
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
        </div>
        <div class="mySlides fade" style="display: none;">

                <div class="usa-hero" role="img" aria-label="North Carolina Secretary of State, Elaine Marshall, in a red sweater giving a speech." onfocus="mySlidesFocus()" onblur="mySlidesBlur()" style="height:375px;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url('/webfiles/img/New_Site_Main_2.png')!important">
                    <div class="grid-container">

                        <div class="usa-hero__callout">
                            <div class="usa-hero__heading">
                                    <a class="spinnerHeader" href="/divisions/business_registration/alerts">North Carolina Scam Alert</a>
                            </div>
                            <div class="para-small spinner-caption">
                                Don’t Fall for Impostors posing as the North Carolina Department of the Secretary to lure loan-seekers to pay an up-front fee.  Report instances of this to the <a class="white-link" href="https://ncdoj.gov/protecting-consumers/">North Carolina Attorney General’s Office</a> or 1-877-5-NO-SCAM.
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
        </div>

        <a class="prev spinnerArrow" style="display:none;" onclick="plusSlides(-1)">❮</a>
        <a class="next spinnerArrow" style="display:none;" onclick="plusSlides(1)">❯</a>
        <!-- The dots/circles -->
        <div style="text-align:center">
                <span class="dot active" tabindex="0" onkeydown="handleKeySlide(event, 1)" onclick="currentSlider(1)"></span>
                <span class="dot" tabindex="0" onkeydown="handleKeySlide(event, 2)" onclick="currentSlider(2)"></span>
        </div>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=eea4439a43d6fdce13006139453cb103efa21bcc&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);
            });
        });

                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
    </div>
</div>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

<section class="usa-banner">

        <div class="usa-accordion">
            <header class="usa-banner__header">
                <div class="usa-banner__inner">
                    <div class="grid-col-auto">
                        <img class="usa-banner__header-flag" src="/webfiles/img/nc_flag_small.png" aria-hidden="true" alt="North Carolina state flag">
                    </div>

                        <p class="usa-banner__header-text">Official website of the State of North Carolina</p>
                        <p class="usa-banner__header-action" aria-hidden="true">Here's how you know</p> 
                    </div>
                    <button class="usa-accordion__button usa-banner__button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="gov-banner">
                        <span role="link" class="usa-banner__button-text">
                            Here's how you know
                        </span>
                    </button>
                </div>
            </header>
            <div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

</section>

<main class="main-content usa-layout-docs usa-section" role="main" id="main-content">

        <div class="grid-container">
            <div class="grid-row grid-gap">
                <div class="grid-col">
                    <article>

                                <header>
                                    <h1>North Carolina Secretary of State's Office</h1>
                                </header>

<section class="usa-section">
    




    <!-- Slideshow container -->
<div class="slideshow-container">

        <div class="mySlides fade" style="display: block;">

                <div class="usa-hero" role="img" aria-label="North Carolina Secretary of State, Elaine Marshall, in a blue coat in front of the North Carolina State Capitol." onfocus="mySlidesFocus()" onblur="mySlidesBlur()" style="height:375px;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url('/webfiles/img/g_elaine_capital.jpg')!important">

                            </div>
                            <div class="para-small spinner-caption">
                                Our Rural RISE NC initiative connects you with mentors, business counselors, funding sources, and more—within your community and beyond. And even better, many of these resources are free.
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
        </div>
        <div class="mySlides fade" style="display: none;">

                <div class="usa-hero" role="img" aria-label="North Carolina Secretary of State, Elaine Marshall, in a red sweater giving a speech." onfocus="mySlidesFocus()" onblur="mySlidesBlur()" style="height:375px;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url('/webfiles/img/New_Site_Main_2.png')!important">
                    <div class="grid-container">

                        <div class="usa-hero__callout">
                            <div class="usa-hero__heading">
                                    <a class="spinnerHeader" href="/divisions/business_registration/alerts">North Carolina Scam Alert</a>
                            </div>
                            <div class="para-small spinner-caption">
                                Don’t Fall for Impostors posing as the North Carolina Department of the Secretary to lure loan-seekers to pay an up-front fee.  Report instances of this to the <a class="white-link" href="https://ncdoj.gov/protecting-consumers/">North Carolina Attorney General’s Office</a> or 1-877-5-NO-SCAM.
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
        </div>

<section class="usa-section">

        <div class="grid-container">
            <div class="grid-row grid-gap">
                <div class="tablet:grid-col">
                    <div aria-label="Business Registration Quick Links" class="usa-summary-box" role="region">
                        <div class="usa-summary-box__body">
                        <h2 class="usa-summary-box__heading"><a href="/divisions/business_registration">Business Registration</a></h2>

                            <div class="usa-summary-box__text">
                                <ul class="usa-list">
                                <li>

            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=eea4439a43d6fdce13006139453cb103efa21bcc&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

[2025-02-12 04:12:27] #alertsDiv
----------------------------------------
HTML Content:
<div id="alertsDiv" style="display:none;">
        <input type="hidden" data-alert-version="10" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1" autocomplete="off">
        



<div class="float-message">
    <div class="float-message-inner">

            <div class="usa-alert">
                <div class="usa-alert__body">
                    <div class="usa-alert__heading">Alerts</div>
                    <ul class="usa-list">
                            <li>
                                Welcome! We are excited about the launch of our new website! The upgrades make our site faster, more secure, and more user friendly with updated navigation tools, new accessibility standards and new features that enhance your online experience.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                            <li>
                                As with any change this significant, some visitors have experienced technical issues.  We are working to resolve these issues as quickly as possible.  If you are experiencing any difficulties with our website, go to Support to report any issues and request assistance.  We greatly appreciate your patience as we make these improvements.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>

        <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=e7ff9a98a17932b1ec389ed2490ee25a18b6b86e&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

        document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function (event) {
            $(window).bind("load resize", function () {
                setTimeout(function () {
                    $("#fbcontainer .fb-page").attr("data-width", parseInt($("#fbcontainer").width() - 50));
                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);
            });
        });
    </script>
</section>

                    </article>
                </div>
                
            </div>

            
        </div>
   </main>

            <div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

</section>
