        </li>


        <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=e7ff9a98a17932b1ec389ed2490ee25a18b6b86e&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);
            });
        });

<div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
----------------------------------------

<div id="alertsDiv" style="display:none;">

<div class="float-message">
    <div class="float-message-inner">
        <a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="CloseSiteWarning()" class="close-link">X</a>
        <section class="usa-site-alert usa-site-alert--info" style="max-height: 300px; overflow-y:auto;" aria-label="Site alert">
            <div class="usa-alert">
                <div class="usa-alert__body">
                    <div class="usa-alert__heading">Alerts</div>
                    <ul class="usa-list">
                            <li>
                                Welcome! We are excited about the launch of our new website! The upgrades make our site faster, more secure, and more user friendly with updated navigation tools, new accessibility standards and new features that enhance your online experience.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                            <li>
                                As with any change this significant, some visitors have experienced technical issues.  We are working to resolve these issues as quickly as possible.  If you are experiencing any difficulties with our website, go to Support to report any issues and request assistance.  We greatly appreciate your patience as we make these improvements.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                            <li>
                                This site uses cookies.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link" href="/Home/Disclaimer">Secretary of State Disclaimer &amp; Privacy</a>
                            </li>
                            <li>
                                To return to Alerts click on Alerts at the top right of the site.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                            <li>
                                If you are experiencing any difficulties with our website, go to <a href="/contact/contact_support">Support</a> to report any issues and request assistance
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
    </div>
</div>

    </div>

        <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=1b731c6ad743d089ae53fa9cc423aefdd811991b&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

        document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function (event) {
            $(window).bind("load resize", function () {
                setTimeout(function () {
                    $("#fbcontainer .fb-page").attr("data-width", parseInt($("#fbcontainer").width() - 50));
                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);
            });
        });
    </script>
</section>

                    </article>
                </div>
                
            </div>

            
        </div>
   </main>

            <div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

</section>

        </li>


        <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=1b731c6ad743d089ae53fa9cc423aefdd811991b&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);
            });
        });

[2025-02-12 04:16:26] .usa-banner__content

HTML Content:
<div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
----------------------------------------

            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=1b731c6ad743d089ae53fa9cc423aefdd811991b&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

        <img class="usa-collection__img" alt="A simplified web page with an PDF logo." src="/webfiles/img/bg_default-document_pdf.png" role="presentation" style="object-fit:contain">
        <div class="usa-collection__body">
            <div class="usa-collection__heading">
                <a href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/TradeStation.pdf">
                    NC Secretary of State Joins $1.5 Million Multistate Securities Settlement Against Crypto Platform, TradeStation (PDF)
                </a>
            </div>

                <span class="usa-label fee">2/7/2024</span>

        </div>
    </li>
</ul>
</div>


    </div>

    <ul class="usa-card-group">

        <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
            <div id="fbcontainer" class="usa-card__container">

                <div id="fb-page" class="fb-page fb_iframe_widget" data-href="https://www.facebook.com/NCSecState" data-tabs="timeline" data-width="418" data-height="" data-small-header="false" data-adapt-container-width="true" data-hide-cover="false" data-show-facepile="true" fb-xfbml-state="rendered" fb-iframe-plugin-query="adapt_container_width=true&amp;app_id=&amp;container_width=469&amp;hide_cover=false&amp;href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FNCSecState&amp;locale=en_US&amp;sdk=joey&amp;show_facepile=true&amp;small_header=false&amp;tabs=timeline&amp;width=418"><span style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 418px; height: 500px;"><iframe name="faa07cc8d2e7b68f4" width="418px" height="1000px" data-testid="fb:page Facebook Social Plugin" title="fb:page Facebook Social Plugin" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" scrolling="no" allow="encrypted-media" src="https://www.facebook.com/v19.0/plugins/page.php?adapt_container_width=true&amp;app_id=&amp;channel=https%3A%2F%2Fstaticxx.facebook.com%2Fx%2Fconnect%2Fxd_arbiter%2F%3Fversion%3D46%23cb%3Df3b3bdc62ef41351f%26domain%3Dwww.sosnc.gov%26is_canvas%3Dfalse%26origin%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwww.sosnc.gov%252Ff3b055947f2f69834%26relation%3Dparent.parent&amp;container_width=469&amp;hide_cover=false&amp;href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FNCSecState&amp;locale=en_US&amp;sdk=joey&amp;show_facepile=true&amp;small_header=false&amp;tabs=timeline&amp;width=418" style="border: none; visibility: visible; width: 418px; height: 500px;" class=""></iframe></span></div>

            </div>
        </li>


        <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=7841173b3cc9e888f4f49c1fcfc8ce861e3792c0&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 422px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

        document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function (event) {
            $(window).bind("load resize", function () {
                setTimeout(function () {
                    $("#fbcontainer .fb-page").attr("data-width", parseInt($("#fbcontainer").width() - 50));
                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);
            });
        });
    </script>
</section>

                    </article>
                </div>
                
            </div>

            
        </div>
   </main>

                                    </li>

                                        <a class="usa-link usa-link--external" href="https://www.ncsbe.gov/">State Board of Elections</a>
                                    </li>

                                    </li>

                                    </li>
                                </ul>
                            </section>
                        </div>

                        <div class="mobile-lg:grid-col-6 desktop:grid-col-6">

<section class="usa-banner">

        <div class="usa-accordion">
            <header class="usa-banner__header">
                <div class="usa-banner__inner">
                    <div class="grid-col-auto">

                    </div>

                        <p class="usa-banner__header-text">Official website of the State of North Carolina</p>
                        <p class="usa-banner__header-action" aria-hidden="true">Here's how you know</p> 
                    </div>

                        <span role="link" class="usa-banner__button-text">
                            Here's how you know
                        </span>
                    </button>
                </div>
            </header>
            <div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

</section>

            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=7841173b3cc9e888f4f49c1fcfc8ce861e3792c0&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 422px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);
            });
        });
    </script>

                                Our Rural RISE NC initiative connects you with mentors, business counselors, funding sources, and more—within your community and beyond. And even better, many of these resources are free.
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>

HTML Content:
<div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            </div>

                <span class="usa-label fee">3/7/2024</span>

        </div>

            <div id="fbcontainer" class="usa-card__container">

                <div id="fb-page" class="fb-page fb_iframe_widget" data-href="https://www.facebook.com/NCSecState" data-tabs="timeline" data-width="418" data-height="" data-small-header="false" data-adapt-container-width="true" data-hide-cover="false" data-show-facepile="true" fb-xfbml-state="rendered" fb-iframe-plugin-query="adapt_container_width=true&amp;app_id=&amp;container_width=469&amp;hide_cover=false&amp;href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FNCSecState&amp;locale=en_US&amp;sdk=joey&amp;show_facepile=true&amp;small_header=false&amp;tabs=timeline&amp;width=418"><span style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 418px; height: 500px;"><iframe name="f20f1c7f34e902c22" width="418px" height="1000px" data-testid="fb:page Facebook Social Plugin" title="fb:page Facebook Social Plugin" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" scrolling="no" allow="encrypted-media" src="https://www.facebook.com/v19.0/plugins/page.php?adapt_container_width=true&amp;app_id=&amp;channel=https%3A%2F%2Fstaticxx.facebook.com%2Fx%2Fconnect%2Fxd_arbiter%2F%3Fversion%3D46%23cb%3Dff0b9c9688f706f12%26domain%3Dwww.sosnc.gov%26is_canvas%3Dfalse%26origin%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwww.sosnc.gov%252Ffbb2ae930d308c582%26relation%3Dparent.parent&amp;container_width=469&amp;hide_cover=false&amp;href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FNCSecState&amp;locale=en_US&amp;sdk=joey&amp;show_facepile=true&amp;small_header=false&amp;tabs=timeline&amp;width=418" style="border: none; visibility: visible; width: 418px; height: 500px;" class=""></iframe></span></div>

            </div>
        </li>


        <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=9ac2288f373e0a8ba6506a5facc574b7ef386a3f&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

        document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function (event) {
            $(window).bind("load resize", function () {
                setTimeout(function () {
                    $("#fbcontainer .fb-page").attr("data-width", parseInt($("#fbcontainer").width() - 50));
                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);
            });
        });
    </script>

                </div>
                
            </div>

            
        </div>

It is completely anonymous.Your responses will only be used to guide policy and help us improve the customer experience.  When you click the link, it will open the survey in another tab so you can complete your business before taking the survey.  Thank you so much for your time.It makes a difference!</p>
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link" href="https://survey.sogolytics.com/r/1nFuys">Online Filing Survey</a>
                            </li>
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>
    </div>
</div>

    </div>
----------------------------------------

<section class="usa-banner">

        <div class="usa-accordion">
            <header class="usa-banner__header">
                <div class="usa-banner__inner">
                    <div class="grid-col-auto">
                        <img class="usa-banner__header-flag" src="/webfiles/img/nc_flag_small.png" aria-hidden="true" alt="North Carolina state flag">
                    </div>

                        <p class="usa-banner__header-text">Official website of the State of North Carolina</p>
                        <p class="usa-banner__header-action" aria-hidden="true">Here's how you know</p> 
                    </div>
                    <button class="usa-accordion__button usa-banner__button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="gov-banner">
                        <span role="link" class="usa-banner__button-text">
                            Here's how you know
                        </span>
                    </button>
                </div>
            </header>
            <div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

</section>

            <div class="usa-card__container">
                <div class="twitter-timeline twitter-timeline-rendered" style="display: flex; max-width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><iframe id="twitter-widget-0" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowtransparency="true" allowfullscreen="true" class="" title="Twitter Timeline" src="https://syndication.twitter.com/srv/timeline-profile/screen-name/NCSecState?dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideBorder=false&amp;hideFooter=false&amp;hideHeader=false&amp;hideScrollBar=false&amp;lang=en&amp;maxHeight=500px&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sosnc.gov%2F&amp;sessionId=9ac2288f373e0a8ba6506a5facc574b7ef386a3f&amp;showHeader=true&amp;showReplies=false&amp;transparent=false&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716" style="position: static; visibility: visible; width: 470px; height: 500px; display: block; flex-grow: 1;"></iframe></div>
            </div>
        </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Be a Smart Giver in the Wake of Hurricane Helene</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – As rescue and relief efforts continue in Western North Carolina, North Carolina
			Secretary of State Elaine F. Marshall is reminding North Carolinians to do their research and give
			wisely to make sure their generosity is getting to those in need. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Give.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Counterfeits Concealing THC-laced Snacks Seized in Multi-County Operation</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>HOPE MILLS, NC – North Carolina Secretary of State Trademark Enforcement Agents recently
			assisted in a multi-county enforcement action resulting in the seizure of more than $313,000
			worth of THC-infused gummies and snacks concealed by counterfeited brands that are popular
			with children and teenagers. In addition to the counterfeit branded edibles, 31 weapons, 1,800
			kilos of marijuana products, and more than $300,000 in currency were seized as part of the
			operation involving 107 vape stores. The operation resulted in 3 arrests and 24 shops were issued
			warnings for counterfeit merchandise. </p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Thc.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">Charitable Solicitations Annual Report Charts Downturn in Donations in 2023-2024</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>RALEIGH – North Carolinians cut back significantly on charitable giving in
			fiscal year 2023-2024, according to data collected by the NC Secretary of State’s Office.
			The just-released 2023-2024 North Carolina Secretary of State Charitable
			Solicitation Licensing (CSL) Division Annual Report states that charities licensed by
			CSL collected $27,053,714 during the 12 month period recorded</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Urn.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <li class="usa-card tablet:grid-col-6">
                <div class="usa-card__container">
                    <div class="usa-card__header">
                        <div class="usa-card__heading">California Man is Sentenced to Prison for $2 Million Investment Scheme</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__body">
                        <p>CHARLOTTE, N.C. – Gustavo Guzman, 61, previously of Fullerton, California, was sentenced
			today to 70 months in prison followed by two years of supervised release and was ordered to pay
			more than $1.9 million in restitution for orchestrating an investment fraud scheme that defrauded
			victims of nearly $2 million, announced Dena J. King, U.S. Attorney for the Western District of
			North Carolina. In November 2022, Guzman was extradited to the United States from Australia
			to face federal charges in the Western District of North Carolina.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-card__footer">
                        <a class="usa-button" href="/WebFiles/Documents/Forms/Press_Releases/Scheme.pdf">Learn more</a>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

      
    </ul>

                    FB.XFBML.parse();
                }, 100);

<section class="usa-site-alert usa-site-alert--info" style="max-height: 300px; overflow-y:auto;" aria-label="Site alert">
            <div class="usa-alert">
                <div class="usa-alert__body">
                    <div class="usa-alert__heading">Alerts</div>
                    <ul class="usa-list">
                            <li>
                                Welcome! We are excited about the launch of our new website! The upgrades make our site faster, more secure, and more user friendly with updated navigation tools, new accessibility standards and new features that enhance your online experience.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                            <li>
                                As with any change this significant, some visitors have experienced technical issues.  We are working to resolve these issues as quickly as possible.  If you are experiencing any difficulties with our website, go to Support to report any issues and request assistance.  We greatly appreciate your patience as we make these improvements.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                            <li>
                                This site uses cookies.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link" href="/Home/Disclaimer">Secretary of State Disclaimer &amp; Privacy</a>
                            </li>

                                To return to Alerts click on Alerts at the top right of the site.
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                            <li>
                                If you are experiencing any difficulties with our website, go to <a href="/contact/contact_support">Support</a> to report any issues and request assistance
                                &nbsp;<a class="usa-link"></a>
                            </li>
                    </ul>
                </div>
            </div>
        </section>

[2025-02-12 04:19:20] .usa-banner__content

HTML Content:
<div class="usa-banner__content usa-accordion__content" id="gov-banner" hidden="">
                <div class="grid-row grid-gap-lg">
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-dot-gov.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Goverment building icon">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Official websites use .gov</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>.gov</strong> website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="usa-banner__guidance tablet:grid-col-6">
                        <img class="usa-banner__icon usa-media-block__img" src="/assets/uswds/img/icon-https.svg" aria-hidden="true" alt="Green padlock">
                        <div class="usa-media-block__body">
                            <p>
                                <strong>Secure .gov websites use HTTPS</strong>
                                <br>
                                A <strong>lock</strong> (   <span class="icon-lock">
                                    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="52" height="64" viewBox="0 0 52 64" class="usa-banner__lock-image" role="img" aria-labelledby="banner-lock-title banner-lock-description" focusable="false">
                                        <title id="banner-lock-title">Lock</title>
                                        <desc id="banner-lock-description">A locked padlock</desc>
                                        <path fill="#000000" fill-rule="evenodd" d="M26 0c10.493 0 19 8.507 19 19v9h3a4 4 0 0 1 4 4v28a4 4 0 0 1-4 4H4a4 4 0 0 1-4-4V32a4 4 0 0 1 4-4h3v-9C7 8.507 15.507 0 26 0zm0 8c-5.979 0-10.843 4.77-10.996 10.712L15 19v9h22v-9c0-6.075-4.925-11-11-11z"></path>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                ) or <strong>https://</strong> means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites.
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
